recommended_movies: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)

simulated_ratings.title: Arrival (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brainy, emotionally grounded first-contact story that respects science and communication.

simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody and gorgeous, but the pace and self-seriousness keep me at arm's length.

simulated_ratings.title: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever time-loop mechanic married to punchy action that actually escalates well.

simulated_ratings.title: Looper (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid time-travel thriller with grit, even if the logic frays.

simulated_ratings.title: Source Code (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, propulsive mystery loop with stakes I can feel.

simulated_ratings.title: Minority Report (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart futurist chase movie with meaty ideas about free will and surveillance.

simulated_ratings.title: Children of Men (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak but riveting dystopia with urgency and world-building that lands.

simulated_ratings.title: Predestination (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Twisty and neat, more brain than brawn, and it mostly sticks the landing.

simulated_ratings.title: Sunshine (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Great premise and tension early, but it loses me as it goes.

simulated_ratings.title: Annihilation (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Eerie, idea-driven sci-fi that lingers, even when it gets opaque.

simulated_ratings.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut bunker thriller elevated by character dynamics and uncertainty.

simulated_ratings.title: The Lives of Others (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Meticulous, humane surveillance drama that hits my investigative sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: The Others (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic slow-burn haunt with atmosphere over jump-scares, right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Coherence (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Minimal setup, maximal mind-bend

simulated_ratings.title: Upgrade (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean revenge sci-fi with a fun tech hook and crunchy action.

simulated_ratings.title: Her (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate, thoughtful look at connection and tech that feels uncomfortably plausible.

simulated_ratings.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive and heartfelt, though the quirk can occasionally overtake the feeling.

simulated_ratings.title: Safety Not Guaranteed (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Low-key and charming, with just enough sci-fi to keep me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Palm Springs (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A breezy, witty spin on the loop formula that still finds heart.

simulated_ratings.title: Casino Royale (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grounded, high-stakes Bond that makes the set-pieces and poker matter.

simulated_ratings.title: Collateral (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, nocturnal thriller with tight stakes and momentum.

simulated_ratings.title: The Bourne Ultimatum (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless and efficient spy action that actually pays off its mystery.

simulated_ratings.title: Enemy of the State (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, paranoid surveillance chase that scratches my conspiracy itch.

simulated_ratings.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cold, absorbing investigation with a truly compelling duo.

simulated_ratings.title: Zodiac (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Obsessive, procedural perfection that nails the grind of investigation.

simulated_ratings.title: The Insider (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Riveting whistleblower drama, exactly the kind of institutional expose I devour.

simulated_ratings.title: All the President's Men (1976)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classically methodical newsroom thriller that still crackles.

simulated_ratings.title: The Report (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sober and infuriating procedural that sticks to the facts and lands hard.

simulated_ratings.title: Prisoners (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, absorbing crime puzzle with moral murk I like chewing on.

simulated_ratings.title: Nightcrawler (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly funny and disturbing media critique that feels uncomfortably real.

simulated_ratings.title: Gattaca (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, idea-first sci-fi about systems and identity that hits my investigative/ethical sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Contact (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sober, science-respecting first-contact story with real stakes in belief vs proof.

simulated_ratings.title: Moon (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quiet, moody sci-fi mystery that intrigues more than it moves me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Martian (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Resourceful, science-forward survival procedural that makes problem-solving thrilling.

simulated_ratings.title: Snowpiercer (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp class allegory with propulsive momentum, even if the stylization keeps me a bit removed.

simulated_ratings.title: Dredd (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, contained dystopian siege with crunchy action and just enough world-building.

simulated_ratings.title: The Prestige (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Obsession, deceit, and clever structure deliver a satisfying, chilly mystery box.

simulated_ratings.title: Memento (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Form and function mesh into a taut, clever puzzle that rewards attention.

simulated_ratings.title: The Conversation (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Meticulous, paranoid surveillance study squarely in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A slow-burn, detail-rich mole hunt that trusts the audience and pays off.

simulated_ratings.title: Sicario (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, controlled descent into moral gray that grips without hand-holding.

simulated_ratings.title: Wind River (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wintry, grounded manhunt with sobering stakes, a notch below the greats.

simulated_ratings.title: Se7en (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless, atmospheric investigation that nails dread, procedure, and payoff.

simulated_ratings.title: Memories of Murder (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, humane procedural that lingers in ambiguity I like wrestling with.

simulated_ratings.title: Michael Clayton (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Riveting corporate morality thriller with the procedural rigor I devour.

simulated_ratings.title: Margin Call (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Talky but tense overnight crisis that smartly maps systems failing in real time.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark Waters (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dogged, fact-driven expose that channels my Spotlight/Insider itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Official Secrets (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear-eyed whistleblower procedural that keeps the stakes human and concrete.

simulated_ratings.title: State of Play (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick newsroom-conspiracy yarn that scratches the itch if not top-tier.

simulated_ratings.title: The Constant Gardener (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Measured, morally thorny le Carre mystery with real-world bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Munich (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Methodical and weighty, compelling in parts though its sprawl dilutes the punch.

simulated_ratings.title: Zero Dark Thirty (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Efficient manhunt procedural whose cold remove keeps me slightly at a distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Heat (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Epic cops-and-robbers procedural with operatic stakes and immaculate craft.

simulated_ratings.title: L.A. Confidential (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Corruption, conspiracy, and investigation woven into a polished noir machine.

simulated_ratings.title: The Departed (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brisk, twisty undercover chess match with gratifying payoffs.

simulated_ratings.title: Gone Girl (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A razor-edged media and marriage thriller that stays darkly funny and sharp.

simulated_ratings.title: The Fugitive (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clean, propulsive man-on-the-run procedural that never wastes a beat.

simulated_ratings.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, existential cat-and-mouse that sits in moral silence I appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Measured, old-school diplomacy procedural that satisfies more than excites.

simulated_ratings.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, escalating set pieces tied to a clear spy plot—my sweet spot for this series.

simulated_ratings.title: Inception (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, propulsive dream-heist with crisp rules and stakes, even if the emotion runs cool.

simulated_ratings.title: The Social Network (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ruthlessly precise ambition-and-law procedural that maps systems and consequences.

simulated_ratings.title: Interstellar (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ambitious, stirring space odyssey

simulated_ratings.title: Gravity (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, visceral survival-in-orbit that turns problem-solving into suspense.

simulated_ratings.title: 12 Monkeys (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy, twisty plague-time loop that intrigues more than it moves me.

simulated_ratings.title: Primer (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dense, uncompromising time-tinker puzzle I admire more than I feel.

simulated_ratings.title: Timecrimes (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut, nasty loop machine that escalates consequences with pleasing precision.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark City (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, noir sci-fi with a compelling puzzle, though the stylization keeps me a step removed.

simulated_ratings.title: District 9 (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: The Vast of Night (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Low-key, talky first-contact mood piece that favors curiosity over spectacle in a good way.

simulated_ratings.title: Midnight Special (2016)

simulated_ratings.title: Apollo 13 (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: The Silence of the Lambs (1991)

simulated_ratings.title: Serpico (1973)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Bookish analyst versus deep-state machinery that feeds my conspiracy streak.

simulated_ratings.title: Inside Man (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A clever, well-engineered heist that keeps the procedural gears visible and satisfying.

simulated_ratings.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, morally knotty manhunt that keeps the stakes human and grounded.

simulated_ratings.title: A Most Wanted Man (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sober, detail-rich counterterror chess where process and fallout matter.

simulated_ratings.title: Syriana (2005)

simulated_ratings.title: Captain Phillips (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, escalating hostage procedural with stakes that feel painfully real.

simulated_ratings.title: She Said (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear-eyed newsroom procedural that centers facts, victims, and the grind.

simulated_ratings.title: The Big Short (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy, acidic systems explainer that is smart and infuriating even if the style distances.
